attributes.description:
If exiting at Central Square, continue to Kendall Station and utilize free shuttle bus service to Central Square. The shuttle pick-up location is on Main St. near the station entrance for the Alewife platform. Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request the shuttle. 

If boarding at Central Square, utilize free shuttle bus for service to Kendall Station. The shuttle pick-up location is on Massachusetts Ave. near Elevator 861. Please see station personnel or utilize the station call box at street-level to request the shuttle.
attributes.header: Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to street) is out of service through Spring 2019 to allow for this unit to be replaced.
attributes.short_header: Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to street) is out of service through Spring 2019 to allow for this unit to be replaced.

attributes.description:
Customers should anticipate adding 15 minutes to their normal trip during this time.

We are improving Green Line resiliency by installing flood mitigation and prevention measures, including large steel doors at the entrance to the subway tunnel. Learn more at https://www.mbta.com/fenwayportal and https://www.mbta.com/GreenLineD-shuttles

If you have questions and concerns regarding the Fenway Portal Project, please email FenwayPortalProject@mbta.com.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible to persons with disabilities.

Please note, there will be no shuttle bus service to Beaconsfield Station. Customers should use Reservoir (9 minute walk) or Dean Road on the C Branch (2 minute walk).

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir
attributes.header: Shuttle buses replace Green Line D service between Kenmore and Reservoir on Sat March 23 & Sun March 24.  Weekend work has been cancelled through March 17.
attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses replace Green Ln D service between Kenmore & Reservoir on Sat Mar 23 & Sun Mar 24

attributes.description: Affected direction: Inbound

attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line
attributes.header: The pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) is closed until further notice due to MIT construction.
attributes.short_header: The pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) is closed until further notice due to MIT construction.

attributes.description:
During garage construction, 592 spots at the North Quincy Hancock Street lot will be unavailable. More than 600 spots will be available in two surface lots: 
350 spots at Newport Avenue lot 
260 spots at Hancock Street lot 

Alternative parking and travel options include: 
403 spots at Wollaston Station during the station closure, with free shuttle service between North Quincy, Quincy Center, and Wollaston Stations.

For more information visit: www.mbta.com/northquincy
attributes.header: Parking has been reduced in the North Quincy Hancock Street Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction of a new garage and mixed retail and residential use building.
attributes.short_header: Parking has been reduced in the N Quincy Hancock St Parking Lot to 260 parking spots due to construction.

attributes.description:
For access to Braintree Station during this closure, travel down to the first floor and use the pedestrian crosswalk to enter the station at the street level.
This closure is due to the South Shore Parking Garages Improvements and Renovations Project. The pedestrian bridge will be replaced by a new garage lobby featuring elevators and stairwells.

Affected routes:
Red Line
North Quincy-Braintree shuttle
230
236
Middleborough/Lakeville Line
Kingston/Plymouth Line

attributes.description:
We are working with our vendor to solve GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area. We have deactivated countdown clocks at some D branch stations so that we are not providing incorrect predictions.

Thank you for your patience as we work to resolve this issue.
attributes.header: Green Line D branch notice: We are experiencing an issue with GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area.
attributes.short_header: Green Line D branch notice: We are experiencing an issue with GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area.

If boarding, use Haymarket Elevator 903 to the Oak Grove platform, then 907 to cross under the Orange Line tracks, then 905 to reach the platform.

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Andrew should exit at Broadway and utilize a station call box or see station personnel to request shuttle bus service to Andrew. Shuttle bus pick-up is located on the Dorchester Avenue side of Broadway Station. Customers looking to board at Andrew should utilize shuttle bus service to Broadway to make Red Line connections. 

The elevators are being taken out of service to facilitate a full replacement of the elevator lifts, hydraulics, and electrical systems.
attributes.header: Andrew Elevator 872 (Unpaid lobby to street), Elevator 879 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to paid lobby), and Elevator 880 (Alewife platform to paid lobby) are out of service through spring 2019 while they are replaced.

attributes.description:
Ashmont-bound Red Line trains board at Harvard northbound (upper platform)  
Braintree-bound Red Line trains board at Harvard southbound (lower platform)

Shuttle buses replace Red Line service between Harvard and Alewife in both directions on weekends from start to end of service, except weekend of March 16-17. The diversion will allow maintenance crews to perform necessary rail, tie, and track work. Learn more here: https://www.mbta.com/RLtracks

Shuttling occurs on the following weekends:
March 9 - 10
March 23 - 24
March 30 - 31
April 6 - 7

All shuttle bus stops are fully accessible. Please allow additional time for your commute. Regular train service resumes at start of service on the following Monday.

Affected stops:
Alewife
Davis
Porter
Harvard

attributes.description: Passengers should allow approximately 30 minutes of travel time between North Station and Porter Square utilizing the subway. Outbound trains will depart at their scheduled time from Porter Square. Inbound Fitchburg Line trains will terminate at Porter Square where passengers can connect to the Red Line for service to Boston. Passengers desiring outbound Fitchburg Line service from Boston must take the subway to Porter Square for a commuter rail connection.
attributes.header: Weekends, March 2 - 16, Fitchburg Line service is suspended in both directions between Porter Sq & North Station for Green Line Ext work. A free subway connection will be provided at Porter Sq & N. Station.

attributes.description:
Shuttle buses replace Green Line D service between Kenmore and Reservoir weekends from March 30-May 5th starting at 8:30pm Friday night for the Green Line Track and Signal project. Weekend work has been cancelled for 4/13-14 & 4/27-4/28. On the weekends of March 30-31 & April 6-7 shuttle buses will begin at 9:00pm.

Customers should anticipate adding 15 minutes to their normal trip during this time. 

All shuttle bus stops are accessible to persons with disabilities. 

Please note, there will be no shuttle bus service to Beaconsfield Station. Customers should use Reservoir (9 minute walk) or Dean Road on the C Branch (2 minute walk).

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir
